snippet: The family of Víctor Jara, who was killed after a coup, is suing under federal laws allowing legal action against human rights violators living in the United States.
abstract: Family of Victor Jara, Chilean folk artist who was killed after 1973 military coup, is suing former Chilean Army officer Pedro Pablo Barientos under federal laws allowing legal action against human rights violators living in the United States; lawsuit against Barientos, who moved to US in 1989 and became an American citizen, comes as Chileans take part in number of cathartic, emotionally charged events leading up to the 40th anniversary of the coup.
lead_paragraph: The family of Víctor Jara, who was killed after a coup, is suing under federal laws allowing legal action against human rights violators living in the United States.

headline.main: Chilean’s Family Files Suit in U.S. Over His Torture and Death in ’73
headline.print_headline: Chilean’s Family Files Suit in U.S. Over His Torture And Death in ’73
